title: Django 4.0 has been released and I'll try it out as I see fit.
body:
[release notes](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/releases/4.0/)

### Dependent Libraries
-  Django 3.2
```
asgiref==3.4.1
pytz==2021.3
sqlparse==0.4.2
```
-  Django4.0
```
asgiref==3.4.1
backports.zoneinfo==0.2.1
sqlparse==0.4.2
```
It is no longer dependent on pytz and has been replaced by the standard zoneinfo module.
`backports.zoneinfo` is a dependency to support 3.9 and earlier.

[backports.zoneinfo](https://pypi.org/project/backports.zoneinfo/)

### UniqueConstraint Expression

It is now possible to specify `desc()` and `asc()` when setting UniqueConstraint to stretch the index.

```python
class TestModel(models.Model):
    code_1 = models.CharField(max_length=32)
    code_2 = models.CharField(max_length=32)

    class Meta:
        constraints = [
            UniqueConstraint(
                Lower('code_1'),
                Lower('code_2').desc(),
                name='code_1_2_unique',
            ),
        ]
```

SQL to be issued
```sql
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX "code_1_2_unique" ON "common_testmodel" ((LOWER("code_1")), (LOWER("code_2")) DESC);
```


### QuerySet.contains
You can check whether the corresponding model exists in the QuerySet.

```python
TestModel.objects.contains(TestModel(id=1))
```
```sql
SELECT (1) AS "a"
  FROM "common_testmodel"
 WHERE "common_testmodel"."id" = 1
 LIMIT 1
```

The query executed seems to be no different than exists(). (if this is the extent of the processing)


To be continued next time

The source code created for this project is [here](https://github.com/kemu3007/django_4_0)
